result.execSummary:
The defendant Carolyn M Scheive was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Comply with recovery program. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Comply with recovery program. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Carolyn M Scheive in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  W. Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

ALSO $1,000 SIGNATURE BOND. Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances - bond condition(s) to be monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc., located at 524 S Main Street in Racine (262-632-1780).  You are to report to their office immediately following your hearing.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. No contact with the victim Rogan Shoes (person, property, residence or family). Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Preliminary hearing at 12-16-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Carolyn M Scheive in court with attorney Christopher M. Glinski.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Waive reading.
Def- Request the court impose a signature bond. 
St- Request a cash bond but will leave the amount up to the court. 
BTC: $100 cash bond ALSO $1,000 signature bond. Must post by Thursday December 3rd @ 5pm or report to Racine County Jail. No drugs or alcohol with ZCI to monitor and no contact with Rogans Shoes.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
